text: sugar snap peas are crunchy and fresh
and good for your body and camembert is
rich and creamy and good for your soul
put them together and you have a salad
that takes care of both so I'm gonna
blanch my sugar snap peas I've already
clean them but before I even start that
I'm gonna make sure to have a bowl of
iced salted water ready the salt and the
ice water is gonna help season the peas
so by the time they get to the salad
they're gonna be perfectly seasoned and
so you really just want to blanch these
very quickly you want them to retain
their crunch it's a minute or so I'm
just gonna transfer them right in here
and now that's gonna stop the cooking so
they will not be overcooked and then
after you scoop all of these guys out
you're just gonna let them sit in here
just for a few minutes until they're
cool by the way you can try that salt
trick with any green vegetable that you
blanch and then you want to get them
really dry the drier you get your peas
the better the dressing is going to coat
them and then the more flavorful they
will be so now I'm gonna whisk together
a little dressing in this bowl I have
lemon juice minced garlic and salt and
pepper and it's always a good idea to
mix those together before you add the
oil the lemon juice mellows the garlic
just a little bit and the salt has a
chance to dissolve you get a better
emulsification if you just added a
little bit at a time see how it comes
together really well in this bowl I have
pea shoots since I'm using sugar snap
peas I thought the greens should match
them so these are pee sheets that are
very sweet as you can't find these you
can use any salad green here but what's
nice about these is that they echo the
flavor of the sugar snaps now I'm just
gonna pour the vinaigrette right on top
and toss it this is not very much
dressing but this doesn't need a lot of
dressing because I'm going to add my
washed rind cheese and really that's
what's gonna give the salad its power
its flavor it's amazing texture and then
over here I have my chervil and chervil
is one of my favorite herbs it tastes
like licorice it can be a little hard to
find so if you can't find treble you can
use chives even parsley
or basil would work and now my cheese
now I know I said camembert but I
couldn't get a super ripe camembert so
in this case I have a different washed
rind cheese wash dry and just means a
cheese that is super creamy on the
inside and very flavorful use whatever
you can get as long as it's runny that's
key and I'm just gonna have it this
creamy luscious cheese is going on the
bottom of the plate and I'm just gonna
spread it out this cheese is perfect and
then you just put the peas that right on
top and you want to try to space them
out a little bit you want all of the
peas touching the cheese and then my pea
shoots right on top this makes it happy
and then you want to just drizzle it
with a little more olive oil just a
touch and then the chervil goes right on
top so fluffy
this dish is just the perfect balance
between freshness and richness
Oh
